key_title: Key to the species of Echium

Key to the genera of Boraginaceae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Boraginaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Boraginaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Shrub; stem erect, unbranched, woody; leaves crowded towards apex of stem; inflorescence produced once only, to c. 3.5 m high
Annual, biennial or perennial herb; stems 1-many from base of plant, herbaceous, erect; leaves in a basal rosette, with smaller cauline leaves above; inflorescence rarely more than 1.2 m high
Corolla yellow, c. regular; all 5 stamens much-exserted from corolla-tube; hairs on younger parts of inflorescences yellowish; probably not in Victoria, see note after genus description
Corolla usually blue (rarely pink or white), zygomorphic; at least 1 stamen included in corolla-tube; hairs on younger parts of inflorescences white
Cauline leaves with cordate to auriculate bases; corolla 20–30 mm long, purplish-blue (rarely pink or white); 2 stamens exserted, the others included; plant annual
Cauline leaves with cuneate bases; corolla 12–15 mm long, blue; 4 stamens much exserted, the fifth included; plant biennial
